lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Given a list of integers, find all the numbers that are balanced. A number is considered balanced if the sum of the digits to the left of its middle digit equals the sum of the digits to the right of the middle digit. For numbers with an odd number of digits, ignore the middle digit. For numbers with an even number of digits, there is no middle digit, so split the digits evenly.
Input
Line 1: An integer N representing the number of integers to check.
Next N lines: Each line contains a single integer X.
Output
Line 1: The count of balanced numbers in the input.
Next lines: Each balanced number in the order they appeared in the input.
Constraints
1 ≤ N ≤ 10
1≤X<10^18
Example
Input
5
11
12321
45654
1234
2222
Output
4
11
12321
45654
2222
